bug.author: xsacha
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Bug Description</denchmark-h>
I created a TRTorch 0.0.3 for Windows and have noticed it crashes at runtime when registering the operators. Backtrace: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61218/87925825-33391080-cac4-11ea-9ba6-991fe3989059.png></denchmark-link>
Schema: trt::execute_engine(Tensor[] inputs, __torch__.torch.classes.tensorrt.Engine engine) -> Tensor[] Function it dies in, while parsing schema: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/4a3aad354a14edb1337c6214c3d3870c136d5286/torch/csrc/jit/frontend/schema_type_parser.cpp#L307>https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/4a3aad354a14edb1337c6214c3d3870c136d5286/torch/csrc/jit/frontend/schema_type_parser.cpp#L307</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Use Windows Use my precompiled TRTorch Link to TRTorch
Prebuilt is available in PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/TRTorch/pull/152>#152</denchmark-link> or for debug library: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/TRTorch/files/4947139/trtorch-0.0.3-debug.zip>trtorch-0.0.3-debug.zip</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Runs <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Build information about the TRTorch compiler can be found by turning on debug messages
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.6.0-rc3 CPU Architecture: x64 OS (e.g., Linux): Windows How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, libtorch, source): libtorch Build command you used (if compiling from source): Are you using local sources or building from archives: Python version: 3.7 CUDA version: 10.2 GPU models and configuration: RTX 2060 Any other relevant information:

comments.comment: I am currently working required updates to TRTorch to be compatible with 1.6.0. There are some issues i have hit from using the 0.0.3 branch. Perhaps that is the root cause? When I compiled on windows I used the 1.5.1 official build from pytorch.org. Ill see if i can replicate once the update is complete.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/narendasan>@narendasan</denchmark-link> Any update on this? More details, exception is: Unknown custom class type tensorrt.Engine. Please ensure it is registered.: trt::execute_engine(Tensor[] inputs, torch.torch.classes.tensorrt.Engine engine) -> Tensor[] ~~~~~~ <--- HERE

I just wrapped up the update to 1.6.0, so I can start to take a look at this. Do you have a short example program that can replicate this issue? Right now what I see is that some of the example applications we have seem to be able to start up properly without hitting this issue.

Every model I've tested seems to hit this issue. I couldn't find a way to not reproduce this. It could be I'm doing something wrong elsewhere. I'd be excited to see a path where this error doesn't occur!
This issue has not seen activity for 30 days, Remove stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days
This issue has not seen activity for 30 days, Remove stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days
